image.altText: One car is covered in a tarp and another is smashed on a city street

items.synopsis: One person has died and a man has been arrested after a car ran into pedestrians and two other cars in Melbourne's CBD.

title.children: One dead, man arrested after major incident in Melbourne CBD

image.altText: An illustration of a person's hand placing a ballot paper into a ballot box held by someone else's outstretched hands.

items.synopsis: Conservative think tank Institute of Public Affairs has been accused of trying to "interfere with Australia's democratic processes via the education system" after publishing an "egregious" classroom resource about the Voice to Parliament referendum.

title.children: This conservative think tank's classroom plan about the Voice purports to be impartial — experts disagree

image.altText: Catherine King stands at lecturn in front of airport signage

items.synopsis: The government's Qatar decision isn't just about preventing Australians from accessing more flights at cheaper prices, but about the binfire that is our national carrier and its multiple failures to treat its staff and customers with respect, writes Laura Tingle.

title.children: The underlying problem behind the Qantas binfire

image.altText: Cruz Pamoana Davis-Tuka with face blurred and handcuffs being arrested by NSW Police walking through yard

items.synopsis: The court heard Cruz Pamoana Davis-Tuka claimed his "friend" Johnson Kokozian was a passenger, not the driver, of a car involved in a crash that killed two siblings.

title.children: Man accused of lying to protect friend over deadly Sydney crash 'left the scene', court told

image.altText: Fire rages behind the canopy of both a eucalyptus and pine tree.

items.synopsis: From southern Europe to the east coast of the United States, debate is raging over how vulnerable the eucalyptus tree is to fire and whether it's doing more harm than good.

title.children: Around the world, Australia's eucalyptus tree is used in plantations. Now, they're catching fire

image.altText: a large aboriginal flag flying above a large group of people at a city march

items.synopsis: The latest poll result for the Voice referendum shows more bad news for Yes with rapidly declining support across all demographics. For Yes to win from here it needs to turn things around fast and undecided voters are in the spotlight, writes Casey Briggs.

title.children: The latest poll for the Voice to Parliament shows Yes trailing No by greatest margin yet

image.altText: People sit on the grass and sunbathe near the Trocadero fountains across from the Eiffel Tower.

items.synopsis: The cost of flights between Australia and Europe will stay high until the end of 2024, when they are expected to drop in price to near pre-pandemic levels, according to the boss of Flight Centre.

title.children: Dreaming of a European summer next year? Bad news, the flights could still cost more

image.altText: Prince Harry with a beard looks down while wearing a dark suit and tie.

items.synopsis: The Duke of Sussex is snapped alone outside the noted royal mausoleum of St George's Chapel at Windsor Castle on Friday, one year to the day after his grandmother's death.

title.children: Prince Harry spotted leaving Queen's tomb on first anniversary of death

image.altText: Lindsey Graham and Donald Trump at a rally

items.synopsis: A report released on Friday reveals that a special grand jury investigating efforts to overturn Georgia's 2020 presidential election results recommended indictments against a much larger group than prosecutors ultimately charged, including one current and two former US senators.

title.children: Georgia grand jury recommended charges against 39 people, including Lindsey Graham

image.altText: Cycling city Copenhagen sprints to become first carbon-neutral capital

items.synopsis: How did Danish pharmaceutical company Novo Nordisk become the proprietor of one of the most in-demand products in the world?

title.children: A Danish pharmaceuticals-maker has just become the biggest company in Europe — all because of one drug

image.altText: Overhead view of youth in prison cell.

items.synopsis: Children awaiting sentencing can spend up to 23 hours a day locked in a cell inside Tasmania's only youth detention centre, the children's commissioner says.

title.children: Inside Tasmania's youth detention centre these kids rap for rehabilitation

image.altText: A woman and two men smile and clap in front of a group of people.

items.synopsis: Actor Sam Reid, who plays a TV news presenter in the series, admits he based his character on a real Australian journalist. And the creator of The Newsreader reveals which ABC journalist influenced another character on the show.

title.children: Which real TV journalists inspired The Newsreader?

image.altText: Construction workers stand along a train platform.

items.synopsis: We are now in a per capita recession: that is, output per person has been going backwards since the beginning of the year. Australians can't work any harder, so what's the solution, asks David Taylor.

title.children: Australians are working as hard as ever, but output is going backwards. Who's to blame?

image.altText: A middle-aged Ukrainian man in a tight combat polo shirt stands behind a podium in front of Ukrainian and Canadian flags.

items.synopsis: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy alleges Russian leader Vladimir Putin was behind the death of mutinous mercenary boss Yevgeny Prigozhin, who died in an unexplained plane crash with his top lieutenants last month.

title.children: Zelenskyy says Prigozhin's death underlines Putin's weakness

image.altText: A close-up photo of a baby gorilla sitting on an adult gorilla.

items.synopsis: There are only around 1,000 mountain gorillas left in the wild — and this vet is leading efforts to save them.

title.children: These communities have gorillas on their doorstep. But it's not the humans who are in danger

image.altText: Eddie Jones looks to his right as he walks on the field ahead of the Wallabies vs France Test at Stade de France.

items.synopsis: After failing to win a Test heading into the men's Rugby World Cup, the Wallabies have been given little chance of success at the tournament. But this is just how Eddie Jones likes it, writes Luke Pentony.

title.children: Eddie Jones has performed a World Cup 'miracle' before, but is a Wallabies' win in France out of reach?

image.altText: a man leaning against a wall which holds a portrait of him wearing an army uniform

items.synopsis: The Australian War Memorial adds information to a plaque commemorating Corporal Ben Roberts Smith's Victoria Cross medal that reflects recent defamation court rulings over his alleged conduct in Afghanistan.

title.children: Australian War Memorial adds plaque with context of defamation case to Ben Roberts-Smith display

image.altText: A sign reading 'Dubbo Hospital' in between two trees

items.synopsis: NSW Police and NSW Health are investigating the death of a four-year-old boy this week at Dubbo Base Hospital. The boy's death has been referred to the coroner.

title.children: Death of a 4yo boy in out-of-home care at NSW hospital sparks police investigation, clinical review

image.altText: A woman with a wound on her elbow.

items.synopsis: Authorities reported the infection of a resident in Batemans Bay as the first time Buruli ulcer had been contracted locally, although further investigation revealed two other historical cases in the area since 2021.

title.children: Flesh-eating ulcer reported as locally acquired in New South Wales for the first time

image.altText: new south wales police as part of taskforce magnus arrest a man who is sitting down on the ground with handcuffs

items.synopsis: Nine people, including two women, were arrested overnight over a range of gun and drug offences, with prohibited items and cash seized, following an operation by Taskforce Magnus.

title.children: Organised crime blitz across Sydney prevents 'two, perhaps three' murders in past five weeks

image.altText: coal spill helensburgh 1

items.synopsis: A mine on the edge of Royal National Park, Metropolitan Colliery, is facing up to $5 million in legal charges in relation to the spill of coal wastewater last year. The New South Wales Environmental Protection Agency alleges the company failed to meet industry standards.

title.children: Environment watchdog to take mine giant to court for polluting national park

image.altText: A man sitting at a table facing several microphones with an Australian flag in the background.

items.synopsis: There are growing concerns about whether the fleet of future frigates will meet the navy's requirements.

title.children: Parliament scrutinises weighty problems on $45 billion warship project

image.altText: William Tyrrell's former foster parents, with faces blurred, are seen during a break at the Parramatta Local Court

items.synopsis: The couple, who cannot be identified for legal reasons, has faced a week-long hearing in Parramatta Local Court, where covert recordings of their home and car were played.

title.children: William Tyrrell's former foster parents considered 'capable and competent' by department, court told

image.altText: Fish floating in water

items.synopsis: Irrigators and nature conservationists are urging the NSW government to implement recommendations made by the Office of the Chief Scientist and Engineer to mitigate future fish kill events in Menindee.

title.children: Menindee fish kill findings prompts calls for NSW government to act, and act fast

image.altText: Donald Trump embracing Rudy Giuliani on a dark stage

items.synopsis: Rudy Giuliani is facing a barrage of legal fees, fines, sanctions and damages related to his work helping Donald Trump try to overturn the 2020 US presidential election and other cases.

title.children: Trump hosts $US100,000 a head fundraiser to help Giuliani pay legal bills

image.altText: The front of a Dymocks bookstore in Perth.

items.synopsis: Dymocks says customers' postal addresses, birthdates, emails addresses, mobile numbers, gender and membership details may have been compromised.

title.children: Dymocks warns customers of data breach after account information leaked on dark web

image.altText: A row of huts that have curved roofs and exterior walls

items.synopsis: A group of heritage-listed huts will not be moved to make way for a new rugby league high performance centre after outcry from community groups.

title.children: 'Iconic symbol' of post-WWII migration not budging for new $50 million NRL team hub

image.altText: Patrick Cripps yells in celebration

items.synopsis: Carlton will face Melbourne in next weekend's semifinal after a nail-biting win over Sydney on Friday night.

title.children: Blues survive Swans surge to mark finals return with unforgettable MCG victory

image.altText: Melbourne Storm's Jahrome Hughes kneels over teammate Ryan Papenhuyzen after an injury in an NRL clash with Brisbane.

items.synopsis: The Brisbane Broncos will host a preliminary final after beating Melbourne 26-0 at Lang Park — their first win at home over the Storm since 2009.

title.children: Bittersweet night at Lang Park as Broncos' historic win over Storm marred by horror injury to Ryan Papenhuyzen

image.altText: Three men wearing yellow saftey vests and helmets carrying a man in wasit high floodwaters in the street

items.synopsis: The region has received its highest amount of rainfall since records began 140 years ago, and residents are questioning authorities' preparedness for such an emergency.

title.children: Record-breaking rain lashes Hong Kong, forcing schools to shut, workers to stay home

image.altText: A sketch of Benjamin Glenn Hoffmann in court.

items.synopsis: Benjamin Hoffmann, who killed four people in the 2019 Darwin shooting, is sentenced after being found guilty of aggravated assault for "swiping" hot coffee at a fellow prisoner.

title.children: Darwin mass shooter found guilty of hot coffee assault on inmate

image.altText: A man with a jacket over his head

items.synopsis: Christopher Borg pleaded guilty to two counts of common assault and failed to have the charges dismissed on the grounds of mental health issues.

title.children: Ex-NSW police officer has sentence cut for 'entirely unprovoked' kicking of Indigenous teen

image.altText: A selfie of a serious man with shaved hair next to his large brown dog.

items.synopsis: Surfer Toby Begg is lucky to be alive after being attacked by a shark on a NSW beach. The off-duty doctor who saved him says he is a "fighter".

title.children: It's 'absolutely crazy' he survived, says responding off-duty doctor after shark attack

image.altText: A man wearing a grey windcheater is led by a prison guard.

items.synopsis: A man who wanted to scare off his dominatrix's boyfriend but ended up committing murder in a 'frenzied' attack will spend at least 15 years behind bars.

title.children: Man jailed for 'sickening' murder of dominatrix's boyfriend

image.altText: A health worker wears blue latex gloves and draws some coronavirus vaccine from a vial with a syringe.

items.synopsis: Here's a quick wrap of the COVID-19 news and case numbers from each Australian jurisdiction from the past week.

title.children: All the latest COVID-19 case numbers from around Australia
